page.title: 01MICHAELCHURCH AND CRASWALL
page.content: {Michaelchurch Escley}and{Craswall} are 2 lonely little communities in the south west corner of the county of {Hereford-Worcester.}They are on the edge of the{Black Mountains}and close to the border of Wales.The west side of the area is much steeper than the east. The population is sparse and scattered,but friendly and always ready to help.The few houses in this area are generally 2 to 3 hundred years old.Most people are farmers.The farms are small and mainly have sheep though some crops,especially grass for silage,are grown. {Michaelchurch Escley}has a post office,primary school,pub, church and Michaelchurch Court,the old village manor house.{Craswall}has just a church and pub.
